page.title: 13SENIOR CITIZENS OF BENGEO
page.content: Old folk are helped in various ways:_ { District nurses}provide medical care, auxiliary nurses bathe them and chiro- podists call to attend to their feet. Any who can't cook get{meals-on-wheels 3 days a week for Â£1.50.{Home helps}do extra cooking and housework and fetch pensions,shopping or prescriptions.The {library}make fortnightly home calls. { Gosselin House}has bed_sits linked to a warden's room for emergencies. There is a laundry room and kitchen/day room with piano, hi-fi, TV and armchairs. The{voluntary}Red Cross offer lifts, use their ambulances for outings, run bingo, films, shows, Christmas parties and even holidays.Other groups such as Richard Hale School, do gardening and odd jobs.{The vicar}will call to give communion and at the church hall the O.A.Ps can enjoy cards and hot drinks. Even so, some old folk still grumble!
